subject: Ah, My Jet Set Life
event:
We are only one day back from the east coast, having even finished unpacking yet, and yet Spokane and worldcon are only a week away.  Sometimes all this does leave me feeling rather ragged.

It was a great trip, though.

My nephew Jeffrey and his lady Kristin got married in Bayonne and enjoyed a lovely lively reception in Morristown, and nothwithstanding the fears of some of you out there, no one died at the wedding.  Pigeon pie was not served.  Nor did we dance the Hokey-Pokey, which is unusual for a Jersey wedding, but I am told the marriage counts anyway.

I enjoyed delightful meals at wonderful restaurants with editors and publishers from Random House, from Tor, and from Simon & Schuster.  Good folks all.  After all the Puppygate craziness of the past few months, it was nice to sit down for a few hours with actual grown-up sane professionals from the real world of publishing, and be reminded what that is like.

I also went on a pizza crawl of Manhattan and Brooklyn with X-Ray and Raya.  Nothing beats New York City pizza... well, unless it's New Jersey pizza, and maybe New Haven's.  We wimped out, though, and could only manage two pizza places.  But the pies were great.

And we visited the training camp of the New York Jets, and got to visit their war rooms and practice fields, and meet Gang Green's GM and a lot of his staff, plus Nick Mangold and D'brickashaw Ferguson.  We didn't meet Darrelle Revis, but he was there practicing, and it was great to see him back in green and white.  The Jets were great hosts, and who knows, maybe I can make it back later this year for an actual game.

And then of course there was Staten Island, and the showdown between the SI Direwolves and the Lannister Renegades.  Much has been written about that elsewhere, so I won't rehash: google if you want details.  I am pleased to report that the Direwolves won 10-1, so I won't need to kill another Stark.  The team made an incredibly generous contribution to the Wild Spirit Wolf Sanctuary as well.  And I have to say, the field there on Staten Island, right next to the iconic ferry, is the most beautiful I've ever seen, with truly spectacular views.

All in all, a great trip.

If only there wasn't so much work awaiting me when I came home...

props.crosspost_tw: Ah, My Jet Set Life http://goo.gl/Nnpjz3

comments.article: George, I'm not sure if you happened to hear the recent news about Geno Smith. I know you haven't been a big fan, but any thoughts on his being out for the next few months, or the incident that caused it?
comments.subject: Geno Smith

comments.article: Glad you enjoyed your trip. What are your thoughts on the Jets' quarterback situation?
comments.subject: Jets locker room

comments.article: Please write about what happened to Geno Smith. I won't ask for anything else, I promise.
comments.subject: NFL

comments.article: Two pizza places is less of a crawl and more of a stumble:). Did you know there's still somewhere in New York selling coal-fired pizza? The pizza's great, and you just brush the coal dust off the bottom and hope for the best.
Actually, there are a dozen great places in NYC with coal-fired ovens.  All the iconic pizza places have 'em.

The Geno Smith incident is straight out of the A Song of Ice and Fire world.  Kid qb, feeling better than he had for previous seasons, with Marshall he had better weapons than ever before... and he gets punched in the jaw by a 6th round pick allowing the average (below) Harvard kid a chance to start instead.
comments.subject: Jaw Broken

comments.article: J-E-T-S Jets Jets Jets!!! :)
comments.subject: Re: Jaw Broken

comments.article: Ahhhh.... I do miss the awesome pizza -and Italian, Greek, Jewish delicatessens, hot dog carts and many other foods- that I loved in the New York/ New Jersey area. I've found a handful of 'New York Style' pizza places in California -and a subset of that group that just about get it right- but it is a testament to how good those pizza's of yesteryear were that they are still the standard I measure by, 26 years later.

Nice to hear your enjoying yourself George, you really deserve it! Today i pre-ordered my copy of the knight of the seven kingdoms and can't wait to get my hands on it, looks like a really good read. P.S. I don't suppose Jeffrey has any resemblance with Joffrey :P
If you're ever looking for a good fund-raising opportunity, I would pay good money to see you do the Electric Slide.  (Less for the Chicken Dance, but I'd probably throw in a 20 for that one.)
comments.subject: Weddings

comments.article: Cheer up Mr. Martin! Think about this way, you get to work on what you love doing =)
comments.subject: Cheer up!

comments.article: If you are ever in Greenpoint, Brooklyn, there's a little restaurant called Adelina's that has this amazing pizza with a fried dough crust. Plus there's so many different kinds of wines on tap. :D
comments.subject: brooklyn pizza

comments.article: Wow, it sounds like it was a marvelous time for all. Congrats to your family on the wedding. I can't tell you how relieved I am to hear about the Direwolves and the victory. I'll have to check out the Wild Spirit Wolf Sanctuary. I support the Lakota Wolf Preserve when I can and the Wildcat Sanctuary. Lol, sounds like I am a fan of both camps. I'm happy you had a great visit and thanks for the news. I added "Windhaven" to my reading pile yesterday and I'm looking forward to delving into it.
comments.subject: There and back again...

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: cheese
comments.article:
It was a pleasure, as always. I think it was the egg cream that really did me in.

Next time you're in town, we will hit a couple of Staten Island places and get a Jersey bar pie. And start at 11am for maximum success. Then we can sit on my roof and drink cocktails and watch the sun set over Manhattan and wonder if we'll ever feel hungry again. :)

In other realms: What In The Hell Is Going On With The Jets. Smith out with a broken jaw and I hear that they're thinking of bringing Sexy Rexy onboard? WHAAAA?
You still did better than I did. One time, I took a two week visit to NYC with my family, and the only pizza we had the entire time was from Dominoes. Embarrassing, in hindsight.
comments.subject: Pizza

comments.article: Why would you do that?  Why, why?  That's like visiting China and eating only at Panda Express.
comments.subject: Re: Pizza

comments.article: Such a thrill to meet you and such a fun night out with my husband.  Thanks for setting it up with the ballpark and setting time aside for it.  A truly memorable night. I'm still smiling!
comments.subject: Thanks for a great time!

comments.article: Were you able to say "D'Brickashaw" with a straight face? :->
Well, I did ask him about his name.  The Wiki report is correct.  His parents were Colleen McCullough fans.  He's named after the Richard Chamberlain character in THE THORN BIRDS.
Forget about Jon Snow, I want to know what you said to Enemkpali to get him to do that.

First off glad you had a great trip! Second, glad the Direwolves dominated the lions as they would in a real life battle with no treachery! Lastly not sure if your aware....(I'm sure you are) but the Internet has been broken while you were away do to your last post. It stated something along the lines of you were leaving minions behind to toil in the paper mines, and next thing you know it's all over the Internet that "the son of Kong" is being printed out at your house while your away and in book stores near you this year. Every Internet "news" (term used loosely) has claimed you have finished and basicly the Internet broke! Crazy to me how you can type a few words in a post on here and people twist them to fit their agenda and push falsehoods all across the Internet to get your loyal fans all excited when you clearly have stated you don't play with the books and that when you are done you will tell us! Just thought you should know your grace. Cheers on the trip!
comments.subject: Thankful Direwolves won and you broke Internet!

comments.article: Some of my fans spend way too much time trying to parse every idle phrase that passes my lips.
comments.subject: Re: Thankful Direwolves won and you broke Internet!
Re: Thankful Direwolves won and you broke Internet!
Re: Thankful Direwolves won and you broke Internet!

comments.article: Your threats appear to work. Have you considered threatening to kill a Stark if the Jets don't do well this year?

George-

New Jersey pizza is good, New York Pizza is better, but I would take Pepe's and Sally's in New Haven over anywhere else in the world!
comments.subject: New Haven Pizza

comments.article: Pepe's is indeed very good.  Sallie's never seems to be open when I pass through New Haven.
comments.subject: Re: New Haven Pizza

comments.article: Rest up big guy. I'm happy to hear that you enjoyed yourself
comments.subject: Deserved Trip

comments.article: Interesting to see that you prefer New York pizza over Chicago style, knowing that you are a NW grad. I just was at North Western for my second visit, and I love me so good ol' Lou Malnati's.
comments.subject: NEW YORK PIZZA?????

comments.article: Chicago has great food.  But deep dish pizza is an offense against the pizza gods.
comments.subject: Re: NEW YORK PIZZA?????

comments.article:
Dear Mr. George R. R. Martin,

I'm afraid I haven't figured out how to message a blog yet, so a comment will have to do.

I know you probably get millions of messages that begin exactly like this, but I fear I am not as good a writer as yourself.

I'm a huge fan of the Song of Ice and Fire series, but I have never had a chance to meet you as I live in Australia.

So I'm sure I speak for a lot of people when I say that I would be sincerely overjoyed if you we're to do a book signing in Victoria some time next year or the year after, or just whenever you find the time.

Best wishes,
Woody Smith
comments.subject: Dear Mr. Martin

comments.article: I have been Down Under many times.  Most recently just last year, when I did events in Melbourne, Sydney, Adelaide, and Brisbane.
comments.subject: Re: Dear Mr. Martin

comments.article: I hope he appreciated your wedding gift, and didn't hack it to shreds with a sword.
comments.subject: I sure hope Joffrey wasn't inspired by Jeffrey

comments.article: Pizza tastes best when you make it at home, from scratch. :-) It's not hard to make it, either. Of course, you weren't at home...
I beg to disagree.  Pizza needs to be cooked very quickly at a very high temperature, ideally in a coal-fired or wood-burning oven.  Most home ovens simply cannot get hot enough to make good pizza.

I actually hate the on going scrutiny, and minute management the internet has bombarded our society with. At the same time, it was super fun to stumble upon interviews or pseudo-news articles of your travels and interactions with the Jets. I had that "HEY, I knew all about that trip!", and felt personally invested. I loved the one interview you had where you stated news bloggers mince your words. Great, great interview. Because you post your own "news" in fuller detail (and better written), I obviously have less issue about how much of your life is on public display. Besides, you Jersey Boys are tough and you know how to battle them media dummies if they get out of line. You just feed 'em to the sad puppies, and then warm up that ole WordStar 4.0 and get to typin' (BTW: Is the computer you use WordStar with Tube based technology? :D)
comments.subject: It was fun reading interviews while you were Jet packin'
